subject: Career
title: Playing the Long Game
description: A quick, practical guide to Playing the Long Game.

hook.text: He helped a junior colleague in 2015. In 2024, that person became a VP and offered him a director role.

buildup.text: Networking payoffs are unpredictable and often delayed by years. The ROI is invisible until it isn't.

discovery.text: People who network only when they need something are transparent. And transactional networking repels.

twist.text: The best networkers invest consistently regardless of immediate need. They play infinite games.

climax.text: Build relationships when you don't need them. They'll be there when you do.

punchline.text: Plant seeds today. Harvest in seasons you can't predict.

quiz.question: Why should you network even when you don't need anything?
options: Relationships built early are available when needed later
